Package org.archive.crawler.selftest

Provides the client-side aspect of the heritrix integration self test.

Class Summary
AllSelfTestCases All registered heritrix selftests.
AltTestSuite Variant TestSuite that can build tests including methods with an alternate prefix (other than 'test').
BackgroundImageExtractionSelfTestCase Test the crawler can find background images in pages.

Package org.archive.crawler.selftest Description

Provides the client-side aspect of the heritrix integration self test.

The selftest webapp is the repository for the serverside of the intergration test.

The integration self test is run from the command line. Invocation makes the crawler go up against itself trawling the selftest webapp. When done, the product -- arc and log files -- are analyzed by code herein to verify test pass or fail.

The integration self test is the aggregation of multiple individual tests each testing a particular crawler aspect. For example, the Robots test validates the crawler's parse of robots.txt. Each test comprises a directory under the selftest webapp named for the test into which we put the server pages that express the scenario to test, and a class from this package named for test webapp directory w/ a SelfTest suffix. The selftest class verifies test success. Each selftest class subclasses org.archive.crawler.selftest.SelfTestCase which is itself a subclass of org.junit.TestCase). All tests need to be registered with the AllSelfTestCases class and must live in the org.archive.crawler.selftest package. The class SelfTestCrawlJobHandler manages the running of selftest.

Run one test only by passing its name as the option value to the selftest argument.

The first crop of self tests are derived from tests developed by Parker Thompson < pt at archive dot org >. See Tests. These tests in turn look to have been derived from Testing Search Indexing Systems1.
